meanings.definition: The act of passing or going through again.
meanings.sent1: The repassage through the forest was peaceful and familiar.
meanings.sent2: We made a repassage through the tunnel to reach the other side.
meanings.sent3: The repassage through the haunted house was surprisingly less scary the second time.
meanings.sent4: Her memories flooded back during the repassage through the old town, like a movie playing in reverse.
meanings.sent5: The repassage of the river in the moonlight was a magical experience.

meanings.definition: A second passage or journey through a place.
meanings.sent1: The repassage through the museum allowed us to see the exhibits we missed the first time.
meanings.sent2: Their repassage through the city was filled with new discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The repassage through the maze felt like a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: As they made their repassage through the desert, the sun beat down relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The repassage through the garden revealed hidden beauty at every turn.

meanings.definition: To pass through or travel again.
meanings.sent1: We decided to repassage the mountain trail for a different perspective.
meanings.sent2: She repassaged the same route to relive the memories of her childhood.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would repassage the grocery store until he found the perfect snack.
meanings.sent4: The melody seemed to repassage through her mind, bringing back bittersweet emotions.
meanings.sent5: The scent of pine trees made her want to repassage the forest over and over again.
